name: atomic entity scanner
description: This is a rectangular, radio-like device that supposedly scans for entities.  The torn label reads: '<color_green>`Find your way!`</color> with the Rivtech atomic entity scanner!  Its simple and robust atomic-age construction guarantees a service life of at least 10 million years.'

name: atomic earthquake generator
description: This is a heavy, radio-like device that shifts terrestrial plates on a small scale, very quickly. The weathered label reads: '<color_red>`Shake it, baby!`</color> with Rivtech atomic earthquake generator!  Its simple and robust atomic-age construction guarantees a service life of at least 2 million years.'

name: atomic flamethrower
description: This is a flamethrower with a bunch of radiation warnings slapped on it, warning the user that pulling that trigger will produce a <color_red>HUGE</color> radioactive flame.  It's got a base color of white, with yellow and magenta markings near the 'screw-you-and-everything-in-your-general-direction' end.  A steel 'RIVTECH' label, though roughed up, still shines on the side of this handheld human rights violation.
